reviews.review_msg: Funny Turkish guy. Cant understand lectures. Dont take with him unless you like reading.

He sounds like French Gru. Nice dude but goes off on tangents; an immense amount of outside effort and work is required to succeed in this course, due to his digressions from course content in lectures. We had to skip 3-5 chapters because he was going through content slowly, and/or distracted with material not required in this course
Not sure why he even is a professor. It's harder to be that bad of a teacher than to be a good one. He had to be trying to do a bad job because that quality of teaching was unbelievable.

Gorkem is a wonderful person, nice guy and always available to answer questions or talk.

Unfortunately, he is not a very good professor. Lectures ramble, meander and are confusing, so be prepared to do a lot of self-study involving the textbook. He's also very poor at keeping to schedule, we skipped 4 chapters cause we ran out of time.

My initial plan was to take econ as a minor, but after this course, I am very confident that I never even want to hear the word economy ever again in my life. I read the whole textbook twice, attended every lecture and tutorial, and did every bit of take-home work that was provided and I still managed to fail quiz after quiz and the midterm

Gorkem is a very sweet guy that very much cares for his students. Midterm and Final were very fair and straight from the Textbook. However, he is not that good at lecturing, so be prepared to read and study yourself. However, he is very sweet in office hours.

You need to put in the time to do good in this class. His lectures aren't too engaging but they help you understand a lot when reading through the textbook. Midterm and final questions were either straight from the textbook or involved a little bit of critical thinking (easy if you read the textbook). Final also had 2 questions straight from mt.
Quizzes are hard but fair. Makes you think more conceptually on the topics. Easy marker and he made the final worth less if you do poorly on it
As far as econ lectures go Gorkem is pretty average. However, he cares about his students and adjusts midterms and quizzes to make sure they are the right difficulty.

Do not take this guy. He is very nice and caring but is simply way too unorganized. In my opinion, I have no idea how he has unlimited supplies of water he drinks during lecture. Also his mic is always broken. Quizzes are next level and refuses to give answers to the textbook.

as a person he's really nice. visited him during office hours and he seemed to care about his students a lot. he's  a pretty easy marker for exams but his quizzes are very confusing and the average of them are pretty low even though its open book. because his lectures are very hard to understand, the majority of the course is self studying

hes so hard to understand and his quizzes and tests are nothing compared to his lectures. does not give answers to textbook questions which is the only source of practice questions he gives us. does not give practice midterms either due to it being too much work for him. also his mic is always broken

This professor is not only a horrible teacher but also a terrible person. I think his parents forced him to be a professor or something, because every day in his lectures he acted like he wanted to use a harry potter spell and disappear out of the hall. He actually WANTS students to do bad in his class, what a sadist!
Honestly I have no idea what he says in classes. I dont understand shit and on top of that there is a lot of content.

Gorkem is a sweet guy but man he cannot teach! Quiz 1 was the hardest quiz I have ever taken it was complete BS. Class average was a 1/5. Midterm was pretty chill but basically had to teach the course to myself. Would recommend to take ECON105 with another prof.

Very unorganized and very hard to understand. Goes out of topic many times and we end up running out of time. TA's are very unorganized. 

Refuses to give us practice questions, practice exams, and even answers to the textbook due to "copyright issues". He's so unprepared that he even claims that he doesn't have time to prep an extra test.

Super boring guy, lectures are just reading of powerpoint which is posted online as well. You have to read his textbook and review his lectures to understand. But here's a twist his quizzes and exams do not relate to his lectures or textbook. Know the formulas but know how to get part of the formulas too. Very hard and boring, I do not recommend.

Dr. Ozdemir is an awesome guy, but I personally found his quizzes to be extremely hard. I read the textbook and even did practice mid-term questions from a past ECON 105 class. But his questions are quirky on quizzes and very conceptual and theoretical. He does not give any practice questions prior to the quizzes to ensure students feel prepared.

Gorkem is a solid choice, however, he is very disorganized and the grading criteria can sometimes be confusing. I attended his first few lectures, but it very quickly became a bore-fest because class discussion often leads the convo astray. Still, however, if I was able to get a B+ by JUST reading the textbook I'm sure you'll be fine!

He was very nice and chill personality wise. Lectures were boring as he just read the slides. Doesn't give practice so it can be hard to understand. Quizzes are worth the most and range from easy to very difficult. Mathematical/graph questions aren't explained well which can make the class difficult. Also hard to understand him at times.

I quite enjoyed Professor Ozdemir's class. His lectures were entertaining, and he always encouraged people to speak up and ask questions in class. Whenever I didn't understand something, he always felt approachable. The class was marked on only 8 quizzes and the Midterm + Final, but they were all very straightforward provided you read the material.

Great person, lectures were pretty entertaining. Very accommodating and replies fast to emails. However, the structure and wording of his questions on quizzes/midterms were horrible. Spelling mistakes, syntax errors, vagueness was commonplace. Also never gave us access to any problem sets, citing budget issues (excuse)

Reviews seem polarizing, but he was a great prof for my entire semester. He seemed passionate about Economics and shared additional knowledge from his own experience. Tests/quizzes were difficult but Gorkem makes an effort to specifically highlight and go over multiple times the info that will be on the test. That may be a change from past semester
Quizzes (50%) were either ok or super hard and were all marked out of 7. Midterm (25%) and final (25%) were fair and open book. His accent made lectures a little difficult to understand.

I think Görkem Özdemir is a great professor. He replies to his emails fast, is very approachable after and during class. Many people wrote here as if the low grade they received was the prof's problem. I received C-, it is because I did not perform a lot of studying it is that simple. Everything about the classes, exams, and quizzes was fair.

His lectures are 3 hours long so its hard to focus in since it is so content heavy. His weekly quizzes are difficult so you will have to use the textbook a lot. Mindtap was a great resource that helped. He is a nice professor whose accessible outside of class. Best advice is to be proactive and go over chapters before lecs so you aren't lost.

Read the book to solve the practice questions and watch videos if necessary, on youtube. Quizzes were the main problems. They were hard and he refused to give us any practice questions to understand what to expect better. He said he'd rather keep the question to himself because he has to prepare new ones for us. Book did not help with the quizzes.

3h class. He just reads the lecture slides. Quizzes are very irrelevant to the material read in slides/book. Honestly, the midterm and the final were okay, but it does not really matter because you do badly in the quizzes that affect 50% of total grade.

Gorkem is a nice guy and tries to do his best but his teaching ability is horrendous. His lecture's will bore you to death and the content of the course is very difficult especially when you have to figure it out by yourself. From the difficult quizzes worth 50% of the grade to the 3-hour lectures this class was not a great experience.
Good prof makes somewhat fair exams but you definitely have to read the book ALOT. His lectures aren't enough to even pass the course but that is expected in an economics course.

Class content could be difficult at times, especially on quizzes when the wording was hard to understand, but overall Gorkem is super understanding and if he notices quizzes are too hard he will adjust the difficulty for the following ones. Lectures were kind of boring to sit through since they were 3 hours long, but overall a good experience.

Awful, avoid at all costs. He just reads slides from the textbook. Quizzes are insanely hard even when you study all the slides and textbook material the questions are worded in ways to really tank your grade. Quiz times range from 20-30 mins making you feel very rushed. AVOID. Overall awful prof.

Dr. Ozdemir did a good job teaching while in a pandemic, make sure you show up to his lectures as he does answer any questions you have, his quizzes are worth 50% of the final grade so make sure you do well on them, tutorials were also very helpful. Overall really nice guy and cares for his students and tried his hardest to make class enjoyable.

Nice dude, just an awful prof. A lot of our quizzes were not applicable to what he actually taught. He added lots of material not in his lectures or the textbook on the exams to tank the class average. Lectures were a waste of time he shows no examples of how to calculate anything or apply policies. Pray you get a good grade due to the curve. Awful
